results.title: My name is Susan Yee
results.creator_credit: Beverly Shaffer, Kathleen Shannon, Yuki Yoshida and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Children of Canada”.
A piquant view of downtown Montreal as it appears to a young Chinese-Canadian. Not all guides are as perceptive as Susan, or as outspoken. At home, at school, at play on the Mountain, she has a sharp eye for adult foibles. The result is a meeting with Susan and her city that is enlightening and amusing.

results.title: Kevin Alec
results.creator_credit: Beverly Shaffer, Kathleen Shannon, Yuki Yoshida and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Children of Canada”.
In the mountainous country near Lillooet, British Columbia, eleven-year-old Kevin Alec of the Fountain Indian Reserve learns to make fishnets with his grandfather, and skin and tan hides with his aunt. He goes fishing with his grandmother and horseback riding with his brother. Life is full of wonderful things to do and to learn. Will Kevin eventually abandon his Indian way of life or will it be a source of continuing enrichment?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Beverly Shaffer, Kathleen Shannon, Yuki Yoshida and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: I'll find a way
results.creator_credit: Beverly Shaffer, Kathleen Shannon, Yuki Yoshida and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Children of Canada”.
When nine-year-old Nadia is allowed to attend a regular school, she knows the kids will tease her but she’ll “find a way to deal with it.” Nadia has spina bifida, a congenital condition that has caused a lack of sensation from the knees down. She uses crutches in order to walk. Nadia, in her own candid way, makes it clear that she is not looking for sympathy. She can do many things that children do, only she has a different way of doing them. (Ten Awards including Oscar, Hollywood; Salerno; Dubuque)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Beverly Shaffer, Kathleen Shannon, Yuki Yoshida and National Film Board of Canada

group_works.title: Hunting wild doves: Dogon people, Mali Highlands
group_works.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker and International Film Foundation

results.title: Hunting wild doves: Dogon people, Mali Highlands
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “African village life”.
Describes how dove hunting is almost a religious festival to the Dogon tribesmen of Mali. Shows how they accomplish this intricate feat without guns. Suitable for upper primary, lower and middle secondary levels.

group_siblings.title: Herding cattle on the Niger
group_siblings.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker and International Film Foundation

results.title: Herding cattle on the Niger
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “African village life”.
Illustrates how the West African Peul (or Fulani) tribesmen tend their cattle, wandering from one grazing land to another. Shows them driving their herd across the Niger River. No spoken word. Suitable for upper primary, lower and middle secondary levels.

group_works.title: Handling and care of the patient

results.title: Handling and care of the patient
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “The Technique of anaesthesia”.
Intended for the instruction of nurses and porters as well as medical students, this film deals with the general care of the patient before, during, and after anaesthesia.

results.title: Spinal anaesthesia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “The Technique of anaesthesia”.
Deals with the general principles of administering the spinal anaesthetic. Two techniques are shown: the first using solutions heavier than cerebro-spinal fluid, and the second using solutions lighter than cerebro-spinal fluid. Their practical application is shown, using nupercaine as the anaesthetic agent.

results.title: Open drop ether
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Technique of anaesthesia”.
Dropping ether on a mask is the simplest method of anaesthesia. The film shows the correct method of using open drop ether. Essential apparatus is demonstrated, premedication discussed, and the correct method of induction and maintenance of anaesthesia shown in some detail.
